Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: finnsarah
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lovely atmosphere- great staff. The rooms are small but everything is good quality. The roof terrace is beautiful. Very good location and surprisingly quiet. If you can work out exactly where it is public transport is very near-no need for a terrifying taxi ride. Breakfast is good quality but limited choice-which was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rod W
Reviews.Content: 10th to 14th March 2012. This hotel is perfect for the tour of Rome Rooms small but modern amenities. (Only for sleeping in!) Quiet location so good Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore is at the top of the road less than 5 mins walk. The Central Terminus is 15 min leisure walk on Via Cavour you can go anywhere from there. Roma pass is a must! Hotel staff excellent attitude nothing was to much trouble even when I had problems with the hotel computer. Did not get to the roof garden but will next time. Ask for directions toLa Mela D'Oro restorante food really good great choice even better prices A MUST Look forward to next trip! PS Book the shuttle bus from the airport cheaper than a taxi and safer than the Metro (pickpockets etc) and saves you hunting for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue W
Reviews.Content: We have just had 3 nights at this hotel. Great service from the very start, friendly, helpful staff on reception and for breakfast. The room was very clean with a good sized shower room. Lovely quiet road, which meant a good nights sleep. Only short walk from Cavour Metro, but it took us about 30 minutes to find the hotel! Walk up the right hand pavement of via Cavour to the first turning on the right, its a steep climb but its the best way to find it first time. Only a short walk from the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Roof top terrace is a bonus and gives you fantastic views over Rome. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: SteveMak_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and is comfortable. The metro is only a few minutes away with the Colosseum and Forum another 5 from there. Breakfast is more than adequate so long as one does not expect a fry up! We shared a mini-cab from the airport which took us directly to the hotel (35 euros), however Italian driving leaves a lot to be desired! All in all a good location to explore a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “roof top nice same about lifts!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise b
Reviews.Content: nice hotel altho very hard to find the first time you get there.we got the train from the airport and got a taxi from the train station to the hotel. I warn people do not use the cabs that are outside the station you are much better off walking down abit and stoping one that drives passed as we paid 30 euros to get to the hotel, which when walking about the next day found was about a 3 min walk from the station! we then got a taxi from the hotel to the airport on way home which cost 20 euros and was about 45mins away.The hotel was in good location but slightly off main road so was quite at night but very close to the train station which was so easy to use.The room was ok clean not the most modern but nice all the same.roof top was lovley view over the city.altho on our stay we got stuck in the lift and only got out due to us having to pull open the door.we rung the bell for help and well what can i say help was not what we recieved.The man just shouted at us press the open door button(shame we didnt think of that eh)and all we heard after that was tutting then was told it must have been us pressing the buttons, now if you can press the number 3 in a lift with out it breaking think there might be something wrong.was later told was a electric problem or something unrelated to the button 3!!!!!!the staff were ok couple was nice but to be honest when you go to rome you will find that everyone is so rude from people walking passed to people in reasturants so staff seemed quite nice.breakfast was ok usual cold meats and cheese. all in all was a average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: funlovin_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and is comfortable; a good value for the budget concious! There is a lovely rooftop that you can go up and view the city as well as the Vatican. Check-in is at 2 PM and don't try to squeeze in a few minutes early--you must wait until 2:00! Same thing for breakfast; doors open at 7:30 and not a minute early. Concierge is very helpful and will share tips on where to eat; call you a cab, etc. The place is not real well known to cab drivers but we found that using the Santa Maria Maggoire as a point of reference was very helpful to them. We found good Italian food within walking distance and were able to walk to the Colosseum easily. Breakfast is included in your room rate and is typical for a European hotel....pastries, yogurt, fruit, cold cuts, cereal, granola, etc. The coffee was a bit strong for me but is standard for Europe's tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa21
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while on vacation in Rome. The room is small and the beds are old. Definitely counted a few bed bugs at this hotel. Luckily I only stayed one night. The hotel needs to correct this problem so that travelers do not pick up this infestation. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Colesseum hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatloverNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The room was a little on the small side but it was adequate. We were lucky to have a second bedroom so were able to use that for our cases. We had a wee balcony with a view and a largish bathroom. The.bed was very comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet location, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Keith M
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from four nights at the Colosseum, which more than lived up to expectations. It's in a quiet road with virtually no through traffic yet only a stone's throw away from Via Cavour, the Colosseum and the Forum in one direction and Santa Maria Maggiore in the other. It's also within walking distance of San Clemente (pretty close) and San Giovanni in Laterano (a little further). For the metro, Cavour station is closest, but Vittoriano, about 10 minutes' walk away and in a slightly less desirable area, is very convenient as you can get to the main sights without having to change at Termini. But let's be clear, it's not in the historic centre itself, which I presume is more pricey. As others have commented, the rooms are a little on the small side, but we had a modern and very new bathroom with a great shower. The breakfast was more than adequate with friendly service, the reception staff were smiling and friendly without I guess really going the extra mile, and the roof terrace is a real added bonus - they'll serve drinks there at very reasonable prices. All in all we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BillS_LondonLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very good, witihn walking distance of most of the main sights (the Vatican is a bit of a trek) and the main station. You could walk from the train/bus from the terminaus at the station provided your luggage wasn't too heavy - its downhill from the station to the hotel. The rooms are clean and funcional, if a bit small, and the staff very helpful. The beds are very firm - I like this but some people might not. A continental buffet breakfast is served downstairs and the view from the rooftop terrace is tremendous. Our only minor gripes were the cost of wifi internet access (€4 per hour, €8 per day,€15 for 3 days), although there is a free to use PC and rinter in the downstairs lounge. Also, as we took our luggage downstairs to check out the lift (small and slow) had broken down and we had to carry them bags down 5 floors. It would not be fun to stay in this hotel without a working lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Bk1717
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location can not be beat. It is central to Rome and is close to the subway and Termini and is within walking distance of most of the major sites in the city. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is small which is expected for Rome. The bed however was terrible. It had many bed bugs which leave bites after you sleep in the bed. We had the sheets changed which did not remedy the situation. For the money, stay down the street at the nicer hotels and avoid being feasted on.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint,comfortable hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: countryhiker
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after 5 days in Sorrento,(where our hotel room had been very large and comfortable). I expected there'd be a bit of an adjustment for us, as I knew that the room in Rome was going to be smaller. However, I have to say we had no problem at all adjusting to the wonderful surroundings of the Colosseum Hotel! Although the lobby WAS very different from our other hotel, the staff at the desk was very polite and professional. After the elevator journey,(which barely held the bellman,my husband and our 2 suitcases), we were most pleasantly surprised by the lovely room we encountered! We'd reserved a "double" and upon entering, we stepped into a hallway with 2 bedrooms off of it on the left, and a bathroom on the right at the end. There were beautiful hardwood floors throughout. We had room 72, which I can highly recommend for it's lovely view both from the bathroom on the right side and a totally different view from the balcony off the two bedrooms on the left. We quickly set up our 'camp' by depostiing the luggage in the smaller bedroom with one twin bed and placed the laptop on the desk there. That allowed us to have more room in the other bedroom where we slept. The bed was very firm but as we'd discovered in Sorrento, that seems to be the case everywhere in Italy. Trust me.We had NO problem sleeping after walking for miles every day in Rome! As for the breakfast,(which was included in the room price), we were very happy with it. True, they do not serve the typical American breakfast with eggs, we usually had a very fresh roll with wonderful ham and cheese. There were also croissants, and an assortment of packaged 'toasties' and jams. Oh yes, and my favorite-Nutella. The coffee was adequate but I quickly discovered that you could get a nice cappichino if you asked one of the attentdants. There's no reason to start your day of sightseeing hungry, as you can definitly find plenty to eat. As for the proximity of the hotel to the sights, I timed our walk to the Colosseum, it took us exactly 8 minutes to get there. Once there, you are basically just steps away from the Roman Forum. Granted, other sights, like the Vatican and Spanish steps are further, they are still within walking distance for the experienced walker. That said, someone who has physical problems would want to take another form of transportation to see some of the more 'faraway' sights. . We estimated that we walked about 10-14 miles per day. Yes, our feet were aching but I actually lost 4 lbs in Rome, eating EVERYTHING I wanted! Thus the benefit of walking. The morning we were leaving, the employee at the desk, called a cab for us to go to the airport. It was starting to get late and he took it upon himself to arrange for another private car to take us at the same price the cab would've been. We so appreciated his concern and willingness to make sure we did not miss our flight. All in all, our stay at the Colissuem was perfect. If you're looking for a quiet, cozy hotel, with old world charm, that is close to the sights in Rome, stay at this wonderful hotel. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: cezcj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year for 2 nights and thought the hotel was very nice. Exceptionally clean, a nice balcony with seating area outside, powerful shower and quiet. Room was a little small but this wasn't a problem as we were out sightseeing for most of the trip. Staff were very helpful (beforehand with some questions I had via email and when we arrived). Just round corner from Colloseum & Forum and a nice walk to other sights. Make sure you have a map to find your way back at nighttime though! We came back to Rome in the summer and were disappointed this hotel was fully booked as wanted to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AlbaA186338
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in May for 4 days and stayed at Colosseum Hotel which I booked it online. The weather was great, Rome is beautiful and the Hotel was 5 minutes walk to the Colosseum. The Hotel was clean, the rooms were clean and good size but the bathroom was a bit too small. The Hotel terrace was excellent and romantic to spend late evenings there. The Hotel staff were okay, I wouldn’t say very helpful and the cleaner did not know what knocking was as three mornings just opened the door while we were asleep. Overall it was very good and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBrighton
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Colosseum after reading the tripadvisor reviews for our four day stay in Rome in October. We were very pleased we did. The hotel is 3*. It is in a very convient location for walking to all the sights and there are excellent restaurants a few minutes away. The room was comfortable. The staff lovely. Breakfast was basic but fine. The roof terrace was a really fabulous bonus. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: tofiapple
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two grandparents, two parents and two teenage children. Normally I take my family to five star hotels, so they were surprised when we arrived at the Colosseum Hotel which is in a side street with no swimming pool, or five star amenities. On first viewing I thought I had made a big mistake booking this hotel....but, after four nights, we found we liked it very much! The hotel is not trying to be something that it is not. If you are not going to be spending much time in the hotel, and are looking for a comfortable bed in a smallish bedroom, with surprisingly attractive shower room, and a basic continental breakfast you will not be disappointed. Like everyone-else we appreciated the rooftop terrace. There is a taxi rank close by, which we the grandparents made use of. A taxi to the centre of Rome costs 6 euros - but make sure the metre is switched on! The Metro is within walking distance - but it is crowded, and BEWARE pickpockets. My husband who has travelled the world for fifty years without incident, lost all his euros in a ten minute journey on the Metro. We walked to the Colosseum and Forum, and the four younger members of the family walked from the hotel to the centre of Rome every day in under 25 minutes. On the first evening we asked the hotel to recommend a restaurant - it was the worst meal we had during the entire trip. The best meal we had was chicken in the 'Chicken House' - out of the hotel, first left, down the steps, cross the main road, first restuarant you come to on the left.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: phillip j
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were small-but decent. The view from the top of the hotel was pretty cool. The hotel breakfasts in the morning were amazing! The sliced deli ham was out of this world! They had great bread rolls and even Nutella. They had great red grape juice and some passonfruit energy drink also.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: pelagic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a booking agency because it was supposed to be convenient to the coloseum and the forum. It was not convenient. To walk to the coloseum was a walk of only 15 or 20 minutes but it was very much downhill and uphill all the way. The hotel is situated on a hill and to get anywhere you have to walk downhill and then back uphill. Also, the staff were not very helpful or courteous. Breakfast was free but it was not very good. The coffee was lukewarm at best. Also, if you book through an agency, you have to pay for wireless internet. All in all, it was a bad choice for us to stay at this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and were delighted with our choice. Our room was a good size and well equipped.The location is excellent for walking to the main sights and for access to the Metro and there are lots of really good cafes and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was extremely good and the staff were really friendly. The staff on the front desk speak excellent English and were very helpful. I appreciated the free computer use and the roof top terrace is great for views over the city and just soaking up the sun. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Valerie R
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome in November 2010 and Colosseum Hotel was the first contact we had with Rome. It was welcoming and friendly and centrally located to all the sightseeing sites. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and had a window overlooking at the streets. If we go back to Rome again, we will definitely stay with Colosseum Hotel . Well done, and keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank021
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed here for 4 nights we found this hotel clean well run and close to all the major attractions,the rooms triple rooms are a bit small but we only used it for sleeping in the breakfast altough not to everyones taste is well stocked and is plentiful we found the staff to be helpful and courteous we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank021
Reviews.Content: just back from a 4 day stay in this hotel its clean well run and in a great location within walking distance of all the major sites.the breakfast may not be for all travellers but as advertised its continental and we found it a great start to the day.we found all the members of staff to be helpful and courteous and the rooftop garden was a great area to relax after sightseeing.just off the via cavour which has great little bar/piazza cafes and some fine restaurants we would stay again if visiting rome

Reviews.Title: “Location was Great but the Staff are awful”
Reviews.Author: GMDowntown
Reviews.Content: The price was right and the location was perfect for our needs. The breakfast was a joke and I would suggest going to one of the local cafe close by. The room was clean and layout was good. Our issue was the night staff. The gentlemen at the desk at night was rude beyond words and was very disengaging.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Points, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Phil M
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a very central hotel in Rome and you're on somewhat of a budget then this hotel would suit you. If you book a few months in advance you will get a great rate for such a central hotel. However, to mention a little about the location... It's only a 5-10 minute walk from the Termini station which is handy, but the local area isn't the most pleasant in Rome. To walk to the local church (S. Maria Maggiore - well worth a visit by the way) you have to walk down Via Paulina which seems to be the preferred place for all manner of man/beast to use the building walls as a toilet - which makes this street a bit off-putting. Walk the other direction however and you're literally a few minutes from the Colosseum. The hotel public areas are a little dated but the rooms are very fresh with new wooden floors. The beds are very comfortable and there is no noise from outside. The only issue I had with our room was the lack of drawers (there were none at all). Breakfasts were a little lacking and could be improved. There were pastries, 2 types of cereal and ham & cheese with bread (plus jams / spreads). Coffee was often only luke warm and tea was available if you asked for the hot water. There were 2 men on reception, 1 at any given time, and it was somewhat a Jekyll & Hyde scenario. The Italian man was friendly and genuinely helpful. The guy originally from England was blunt and unwelcoming to the point of being rude. His attitude towards guests could seriously be improved (starting by maybe smiling every now and then). Don't lose your room key because they will charge you EUR150 to replace it. We were only told this after 2 days after Mr Surly (above) admonished me for not handing in my key at reception when we went out for dinner. He also insisted that this charge was explained at check-in, but it certainly wasn't. Just bear this in mind... The rooftop terrace is very relaxing and provides fantastic views of the city. Nice to chill out up there after a day sight-seeing. Please note that the lift only goes to floor 7 and there is another flight of stairs to get to the roof-terrace - so not very accessible for anyone less mobile. All in all, the hotel has a lot of good points, especially its convenient location for all the tourist sites. The rates are reasonable and the rooms are pleasant and comfortable. There are a few negatives, but on balance it's a 2* hotel with potential.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TechnoPsych
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both before and after our Med cruise. It's on a side street near St. Mary Major - being on the side street meant it was quiet which for sleeping was great. It has a rooftop terrace with outstanding views and is a great place to talk about the day. The rooms are quiet adequate size wise - but it's a European style hotel, so not US sized. They are simply furnished. Beds were very hard and a double is two twins beds pushed together. Everything was spotlessly clean and all looked updated. All staff spoke English - some better than others but we were always able to communicate what we needed. Check in time is 2pm - and they don't do early check in (which is hard when you're coming off an overseas flight). Had to wait for 2 hours to be able to shower. The only caution I'd have is that the showers are pretty small and leave very little room to turn around and doors can't open fully because of the position of the bidet and toilet. We were able to manage fine, but individuals of size may find it very challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tcoleman3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, A/C was great, the guys at the front counter were grumpy and worthless as fas as help. When asked a question they just held up their hands as if to say "we know nothing" and they did! It was the worst experience we had on an otherwise great trip. It's cheap - but don't expect a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is just perfekt for couples”
Reviews.Author: klaussp
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It only 3 stars, but it's location is perfect. The service and cleaning is also in top. It is in walking distance to Forum Romanum, Colosseum, and the rest of Rome. It's quit in the evening and night. The rooms are small and the view from our windows was not exciting - but with that location so close to everything, you dont need a windows. The beds are hard. It is locatet so you have to be able to walk - not so good for handicapped.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Hotel Colosseum.”
Reviews.Author: JamesMGreenock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Colosseum from August 3rd until August 9th. I found the Hotel perfectly adequate for my stay in Rome. My room was comfortable clean and tidy, the staff were perfectly pleasant at all times. I saw the odd report on hear about some abrupt staff, well I did not find this, people do have different personalities but that should not be viewed as rudeness. My breakfast was sufficient, and the Hotels location provided easy access to all the places that i wished to visit in this great city. I would certainly recommend a stay at the Colosseum Hotel, and will certainly go there again on my next visit to Rome. Great value, but great service too! Thanks to all at the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Descent place but I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JHMIII
Reviews.Content: The location was not as advertised. It was at least a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum. Free computer with internet access is in the lobby but they only have one and it was always being used. Wifi in the room is really expensive, around 8-10 euros per day. Also had to pay a 3 euro fee to get a key for the safe in the room which really annoyed me. For the price we paid, I think we could have done much better and will stay in a more centralized location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mibrooks27
Reviews.Content: You wont just ind theives and pickpockets at the Colloseum. A stay at this hotel will provide you with a whole new class of thievery. First off, their advertising is misleading, to say the least. They offer "free" internet at a horrible computer downstairs. You will pay 8 Euro's a day for WIFI or a room connection. "Room Service" amounts to their ordering food from a local restaraunt that overcharges for the worst food you will ever eat. The desk clerks get kickbacks for taxi recommendations, etc.. We made the mistake of reseving a taxi from this hotel and ended up paying $150 for a ride that the cab compay normally charges $30 for! Add in bands playing at 11 o'clock at night, dirty rooms, lump beds, an elevator that will scare the daylights out of you, and a breakfast you wouldn't feed to a dog, and you have a hotel that is best avoided. I have NEVER stay at a hotel this bad before and hope to never tstay at one this bad again. Avoid this "bargain" at all costs; it will be the low point of any trip to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome balcony”
Reviews.Author: rwethere
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms on the hotel website last minute (the night before) and thanks to travelgeek3's recommendation asked for room 72. Did not really expect to get it but the rate on their website was great and took a chance. We got lucky and got this room with the terrace. I loved it, having a drink in the evening looking at the top of the Colosseum! Thanks travelgeek3! Yes the rooms are somewhat small but how much time do you spend in there anyway? There was some question about the second room, they did not seem to have the booking for it. As it turned out our neice and nephew were delayed one night anyway so it was not an issue. However, we asked that they be able to use that night at the end of their stay and they refused. If they had the room waiting for them it would have been one thing... The hotel is close to the train, metro and Colosseum, which is exactly what we were looking for. I wanted to walk to the Colosseum at night so it was perfect. Got some great shots. The day guy at the front desk is a little short but I think it's mostly a language thing. The night guy was always pleasant and helpful. Everyone was helpful, they let us print our train tickets we bought online. The wi-fi is free if you book through their site. The breakfast was not spectacular but for the price we paid I won't complain. The girls working the breakfast always had a smile for everyone, what a great way to start the day. Aside from the Colosseum, everything was a short metro ride away and being that close to the train station made our exit quite easy as well. I would stay here again, book on their website for the best rates especially last minute.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay and view of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tblsjm5
Reviews.Content: Old world charm. Very helpful desk help and internet. Great view from roof top patio. Clean with good complementary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Rome on quite street”
Reviews.Author: KimC1234
Reviews.Content: THis was a great surprise. Had to book at last minute because of a problem with the original hotel. The rooms look out over the tops of Rome and from the top patio, you have a wonderful view of Rome. The service was friendly and wonderful. Booked a shuttle and even though we were 8 hours late - they shuttle was there. The rooms were not fancy, but very clean and the bathrooms were great. Located within walking distance of the colosseum. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here next time”
Reviews.Author: Gary189852
Reviews.Content: Our room was near the stairs and you will be disturbed by the noise from it, from the rooms next to yours and from the street if your room is in the front side. Asked for another room and the man in the reception said that we could change rooms in a few days but it never happened. It´s very hard to squeeze in to the shower. The showerdoors won´t open because of the tight bathroom. The atmosphere at the hotel is not friendly. The extra city tax was 30+ euro. Stay closer to Fontana di Trevi/Spanish steps for a nice Rome holiday

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fair rate, great location”
Reviews.Author: jrc03
Reviews.Content: Great location, few blocks walk from metro and the train, and around the corner from the coloseum and some nice resturants. Rooms were nice, clean, bathrooms were updated. No washcloths in any Italy hotels! Breakfast was very good. We asked to use the printer one night and the guy at the desk could not figure out how to do it. Sometimes directions was an issue if the desk was busy. I found this hotel in Frommers book, and if your looking for a nice, clean, safe hotel with nice staff, I recommend this hotel. We stayed 3 nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KellyAngelHeart
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the good Tripadvisor reviews and are wondering what on earth everyone else on here is thinking. We arrived earlier than check in and although our room was ready the rude man on the front desk said we had to wait 4 hours and to put our case in an unlocked room. It was dodgy, unsupervised and grotty. We risked it and checked in later and was horrified by the tiny size of the room, the rock hard bed and grotty decor. It was poor. It was clean at least and they did clean it daily although we were on the first floor and the staff left our window open which made us angry as security was an issue. You had to pay extra for the key to the safe. The location is not great. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum and much further to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc. The hotel is round the corner from a swingers club and a strip club and the road it's on is quiet but dull. We wished we'd have stayed nearer the Pantheon where the action was. And don't even get me started on breakfast. All cold with a bit of meat and horrid cheese, otherwise packet bisuits and the like, a couple of cereals and disgusting coffee - surprising given Italians pride themselves on the quality of their coffee - and sugary OJ from a machine. Disgusting. We only tried it once and left it the next day. Luckily we only stayed here 2 nights before moving on to Matera. The positives? It was clean at least and the guy on reception in the evening, although curt and unfriendly, was very helpful. The roof terrace is also nice although with no bar you have to buy your own drink. Overall, you can say you get what you pay for and this is OK for a 3 star but there are better 4 star hotels for not much more money. This is overpriced. Poor, poor, poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: geerickson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Colosseum for one night prior to a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel was within easy walking distance of the main train station and metro and to the major sights such as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Plaza Navona, etc. It was very quiet at night despite its proximity to major tourist attractions. Our room had a small patio that was surrounded by plants and vines, which was a very pleasant addition to our accomodations. The room was small but done very tastefully, and the recent remodeling in the bathroom was done very professionally. The rooftop patio afforded terrific views of the surrounding area, including a view of the upper section of the Colosseum. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful during our stay. The continental breakfast was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay would return!”
Reviews.Author: travelgeek3
Reviews.Content: We requested Room 72 or 74 with the terrace but they were already booked so we had asked for a "high floor" and they gave us a room on the 6th floor. It was very clean and comfortable...and VERY QUIET!! :) That's the best part!! The smal elevator didn't bother me but then again we don't have that much luggage when we travel. As for the room, the shower is seperate from the toilet and sink behind another door, so I kind of liked that! Felt like there was more room to shower. We had to wait for their check in time after arriving from the airport but they allowed us to wait comfortably in the lobby area. Breakfast was basic but ok for what it is. Mostly I ate yogurt and a croisant and finally figured out the coffee machine to get a half decent cup after 3-4 tries. The american coffee isn't american at all...it's really weird. So I finally selected Cappuchino and it was the closest to what I prefer. Just play with it and see what you like. They say that you can get espresso by asking them for it as it isn't in the machine. Location is great. Short block or two from the train station and everything else you need within walking distance - grocery store for water, wine, fruits, crackers, etc.; restaurants (although none we were crazy about); a laundry mat if you need it and even an internet cafe if you prefer to go there. We ate at a restuarant accross from the actual Colosseum that was fantastic! Cafe something...forget the name but it was great! The rooftop terrace at this hotel is great! Nice way to end the day. Had a great stay, thanks to all the reviews here we were able to sleep well and therefore enjoy our time in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING 5-NIGHT STAY AT HOTEL COLOSSEUM!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzmarie62
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Colosseum for 5 nights in May 2011. We stayed there with my parents (Baby Boomers) and my sisters and I are all in our twenties. It was the perfect place. We stayed on the 7th floor, and the views of the city were amazing. We almost did not want to leave the room, because the sights were so beautiful. From our rooms, we could actually see the Colosseum. The hotel is incredibly clean, and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. Everyone at the reception desk speaks English, so there were no language problems. The breakfast is the standard European style, but it was just fine for us. The area is quiet, and within walking distance of Termini station and the Cavour Metro stop. You really couldn't ask for a better hotel in Rome. We truly enjoyed our stay there; we'd definitely go back again, and we would recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family who may visit Rome. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Ask for Room #72”
Reviews.Author: georgiagina
Reviews.Content: Very "European" vs. American...room was clean. We were blessed with top floor and room with balcony. Views from rooftop terrace were outstanding and wonderful way to end the day and watch sun set over the Vatican. Breakfast wasn't our style but looked like people were enjoying it. Lift was small and we walked down the 7 flights each time and almost walked up each time. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: lsd70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, 15 minutes walk from Piazza di Spagna. Room was small and simply furnished. Not so much space to work. The bathroom was small, but perfectly functional. Breakfast was quite standard, but good quality. Negative point no real italian espresso, only basic coffee from the machine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very clean hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JanRColchester
Reviews.Content: The other reviews seem to cover this hotel. Our room wasn't that large but was spotlessly clean. The location was great - we walked to all the major sights except the Vatican when we bought 3 day passes from Roma Christian bus tours which covered all forms of travel for about 25 euros each. Some staff weren't quite as friendly as others but you still felt welcome. Breakfast was good - fresh rolls, meats cheese, pastries etc but I can understand others comments about the juice tasting powdered and the lack of fresh fruit. It is a good 3 star hotel. All in all we would be happy to stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Mueller_BG
Reviews.Content: When I was searching for a hotel for our trip to Rome I wanted a small romantic hotel within walking distance of some major sights and an easy way to travel around with the metro. Also wanted it to be clean and quiet and I got all that from our hotel. Here are the pros and cons: - Great location, within walking distance of the Colosseum (5-10 minutes). On a small street, so very quiet, but only one street away from the main street Via Cavour where you can get the Metro (just 3 minutes away by foot) - Clean rooms and nice staff - Breakfast was great and you can take coffee or other beverages to your room or to the rooftop terrace and enjoy there. - Rooftop terrace is great to relax before you go around the city after breakfast and relax and chat with other travelers in the evening. - We booked upfront and the price was very good for a hotel like this. The only problem that we had was with the air conditioning that there was some noise coming from it and we had to try to fix it, because it disturbed our sleep, but this should be just one incident and they fixed it. So, it was probably just our room with this problem. And also there is Internet, but it was paid and not very cheap. Other then that I loved this hotel and would come back every time when I visit Rome. Been there twice and hope I can visit again soon. A great city. Also we went for one day to Lido di Ostia and enjoyed the beach. Did not know that I could have a day at the beach when I visited Rome the first time. And also don't miss Tivoli and Villa D'Este. Go to the Vatican of course :).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our Europe Trip”
Reviews.Author: bchbebe11
Reviews.Content: Best hotel of our European trip, it was clean, fairly roomy, GREAT location, nice breakfast, and we couldn't resist heading up to the rooftop to enjoy some wine after a long day of walking around the city. From the rooftop is a view of the Vatican and Colosseum. Close to Termini station and St. Maria Maggorie Church. This stay couldn't have been better. Our parents stayed there two months later and also loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view of the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Tim4024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. Our room was amazing we had a small room with a sofa type bed and a larger room with a double bed. We had a large balcony joining both rooms and an amazing view of part of the Colosseum. The train statiion and all major attractions other than the Vatican City were no more than a 20 minute walk. We took the metro, which is less than a five minute walt from the hotel to the Vatican. I believe the metro ride was less than 20 minutes and two metro tickets which you could use as many times in a day were approximately 10 Euro for both. Breakfast was not bad needed some fresh fruit. The WIFI internet is excellent just ensure you do not install it on a portable device if you are planning on using a laptop. You are given one free access code which can only be used on one device so save it for your laptop. The staff during the day did not seem as friendly as the night shift, however all staff members were polite and assisted. There is a grocery store a few minutes from the hotel towards the main train station. There are lots of great restaurants in the area. Note there were three rooms in our wing of the hotel and ours was the largest and the other two seemed very small, contact the hotel staff prior to booking to ensure you are going to get a large room. Almost forgot about the roof top terrance. It is a beautiful sight during the day and in the evening you can bring your own drinks up or they will deliver them from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - but not great”
Reviews.Author: Dusin
Reviews.Content: Sum up: Location: Good Rooms: OK Breakfast: Not that great... Service: Grumpy

Reviews.Title: “Average place great location”
Reviews.Author: bagsyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 days in Feb. Place was in nice secluded street, handy for station and very central. Staff were ok but not helpful (seemed uninterested) breakfast was awful (worst coffee in the world). room was v clean and shower was good. Very quiet, apart from noisy guests returning late but that's not the hotels fault. Roof terrace view was wonderful, and lovely to sit up there with a drink (bring your own, there's no bar.) All in all a nice quiet place but don't expect luxury. PS if you want a great steak try the Argentinian steak house down town from hotel on via cavour, best food we eat in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: ElenaBucharest
Reviews.Content: Overall I am pleased about this hotel. It's easier to say what wasn't so good. The location was ok, in the very center, but a little bit on a sideway street. The breakfast was the same during 3 days, which was ok, because you could still vary. Else, everything was perfect: reception - helpfull, even before coming, clean (everyday the room was checked), quiet.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....many better options.”
Reviews.Author: Lon_Yaeger
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia, no problem. When we arrived after a long Mediterranean cruise at about 11:00 a.m., our room wasn't ready. It happens, and I understand that. We had two heavy suitcases and no one even thought about helping us with them. We asked if we could store them and were pointed to the luggage storage room. Got to the room, the "king" bed was two twins pushed together. Had paid for Internet access, but could only use one hour of battery on the laptop because they had no adaptor for the electricity. So we got maybe one hour of use out of the Internet with no offer to give us our money back because THEY didn't have the right adaptor (but maybe I should have known to bring my own, granted). Went to check out the next morning, the man at the desk was very unhelpful. I asked if I could get a receipt, said I had to get it through Expedia, but said I had no additional charges. At 7:00 a.m., the wife could smell the coffee brewing and asked if she could have some, was told "no, not until 7:30. When I asked if he could call to cancel the prearranged cab I had set up, he said "I will dial it, but you have to talk to him." Fine. We get in the cab and get several miles away from the hotel when the cab driver got a call. The operator told him that we had left without paying the hotel tax and that we had to turn around and bring them four Euros. We gave the money to the cab driver to take back. This was after we were told we had no additional charges.....? We were panicking, thinking we had left something important at the hotel. We noticed SEVERAL nice hotels in that area and had friends staying at others. Theirs were MUCH better at comparable rates. I am taking language and customs barriers into account when I write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: SDamico
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, a little hard to find. Not on a major road, which was good as it was quiet. Parking is limited, luckily we didn;t need it. The rooms are adequate. A little small but bed was comfortable, bathroom was small, and the shower was okay. Complimentary breakfast was mostly cereals, bread, yogurt, cheese and sliced meats. It was okay. Wi-Fi is available at $15 Euros for 24 hours, it didn't always work in your room but did in the lobby/bar area. The rooms are a little pricey but no different from anywhere in Rome. What makes the place a good place to stay is it is within 10-15 walk of the train station and 10-15 walk to the Colosseum, Forum and Circus Maximus. Several interesting cafes in the neighborhood and several churches,including the church Peter in Chains. It is not the Ritz but a nice hotel, clean and within easy walking distance of several churches and the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “great location run by nice people”
Reviews.Author: francescaTG
Reviews.Content: This hotel has about 60 rooms on 7 floors on a quiet street midway between the train station and Colosseum and a couple of blocks from Cavour metro and a grocery store. Rooms were small but clean and functional, although some might find the mattresses lacking in comfort. If you are large - ask for a shower with sliding doors. Rooms had large windows with electric shades which kept out any noise at night and allowed one to regulate the temperature. Breakfast was yogurt, cereal, bread, pastries, juice, coffee, meats and cheese as well as assorted jellies, butter, nutella, and cookies. My always hungry 16 year old son was able to construct a more than ample breakfast. The coffee came from a machine and was awful. But the machine made ok hot chocolate and heated water and there were plenty of good tea choices. The staff was pleasant and helpful. It was perfect for our 10 day stay as we spent very little time in the rooms and could walk everywhere from this quiet central location. There is a computer and printer in the lobby as well as two sitting rooms with a small library of novels in various languages. This is not a non-smoking hotel but our rooms and linens and the breakfast room did not smell of cigarettes but the halls and lobby some times did.

Reviews.Title: “Godd location, simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: SaigonGrill
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel with great location in central Rome. Just between Santa Maria Maggiore and the Colosseum. Walking distance to many of Rome's sights, though sometimes I'd recommend a Taxi or subway (For Vatican or Villa Borghese). Room was simple but nice and clean. Area is pretty quiet which is nice and the hotel got a lovely roof terrace with stunning view over the city. The are a few sun chairs and tables with chairs up there and I would recommend getting some bread, fruit, cheese, ham, olives and wine from a local store and have lunch up on the terrace. Breakfast is included and was very good with a nice selection. The hotel got wifi and also a computer in the lobby that you can use (though for a hourly charge). Very nice hotel. Good value for Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: ReisenderGermany
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Rome in the end of Nov. Personally, I do not need luxury accommodation, but I do enjoy cleanliness and a proper modern standard. Both are supplied by this hotel, the room was very clean, proper upkeep & layout, good furniture, clean & modern bathroom, staff was polite & neutral. Breakfast was basic to average. For $90 a night in a capital this is very decent value for money, hence I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value for money. Don't pass this hotel by...”
Reviews.Author: SwingSinger
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel off the internet through expedia. I selected it on the basis of price and location. The hotel is situated in a quiet side street just a short stroll from Roma Termini station and a number of great restaurants. The Colossuem/Pantheon/Trevi Fountain etc are all within an easy walk. We even walked to the Vatican and back about 45/50 mins each way but passing some great sights on the way. So location perfect. The reception staff were polite and courteous, the room (although twin beds) was perfectly fine. The hotel was clean throughout and our room was made up daily to the highest standards, even for a 3*. The inclusive breakfast was ample for a kick start to the day. Cereal/Yoghurt/Breads/Pastries/Meats and Cheese with unlimited fruit juice tea or coffee. I have no idea where other contributors heard any loud muisc at 2am from Blue Moon we heard nothing at all. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and should we ever return to Rome in the future would not book anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelfiend
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our third stay at the Colosseum Hotel. We love this hotel. It is consistantly good. The breakfasts are terrific - the rolls, meats, and pastries are top notch. They don't have a lot of turn over and we see the same wonderful staff members year after year. They have a wonderful roof terrace that is perfect for unwinding at the end of the day. The rooms are cozy and the beds are very comfortable, the linens are fresh, and the maid service is excellent. The location is a convenient starting point for Rome sightseeing and getting to the Colosseum and Forum in a five minutes walk. Whenever we are in Rome, we feel at home at the Colosseum Hotel and hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but well placed”
Reviews.Author: BMROxford
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colosseum Rome is a basic travellers hotel which provides what you need so long as you aren't expecting luxury. It is about 10 mins from The Colosseum itself, and only 3 mins from nearest metro station. We had a triple room which was no frills - but clean and comfortable. We only used it for sleeping - so it was fine. Breakfast was adequate - usual continental fayre. No bar there to speak of - they will sell you a mini bottle of wine for about 4 euros - but the white isn't cold so stick to red! The rooftop terrace is probably nice in the summer but in November we didn't use it. Out and about in Rome - look for the DAKOTA bar - cheapest beers we could find, and great staff. Lots of reasonabley priced eats so long as you stay away from the big piazzas. Book your vatican tour with Seven Hills Tours - Andreas is great and only 39 euros for 3 hours - and you only reserve online but don't pay till you meet up with him. Don't use the first Coloseum guide you find at the site - the further back you go the cheaper the guide - 8 euros as opposed to 15 euros! Don't bother with the Roma Pass - waste of money. We didn't save a penny using it. You can buy a 3 day travel pass for 11 euros which covers trams, metro and buses. We were lucky with crowds in November - nothing was too busy. Dread to think what it would be like in summer - with the heat aswell.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel close to the subway”
Reviews.Author: soyee
Reviews.Content: i like the location, it's about 2 minutes from the Cavour subway station. the location is not too too central but it's within walking distance to the colosseum and roman forum (about 10 minute walk). the street is a bit quiet so if you're travelling alone at night be careful. the room is clean and spacious. the staff is helpful. breakfast is buffet style and is quite good. the room rate is a bit too high thou I think.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Spence_SD
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a nice little hotel, on a quiet side street, within comfortable walking distance of the train station, the colosseum, the metro line, etc. I stayed Tuesday through Friday night and had no problem with bar/club noise that others complained about. Room was decent, a bit small, but this is central Rome (have you seen the closets that pass for hotel rooms in central Manhattan?) I found the staff to be friendly, helpful, and multi-lingual (Italian, English, French and German that I heard). Small safe built into the wall came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: seaglass_07
Reviews.Content: It's true you only need the hotel to sleep in but don't expect much sleep if you stay here. Looks like it's on a quiet street until the strip club, Blue Moon, around the corner opens and music pounds until 2:00 am. Asked for a room change, but the desk staff did not accomodate. We reported clothes that went missing, presumably taken out with the linens. These were not found but when we returned to the room, it was clear someone had gone through our things and prescription pain medication had been taken. The desk staff was not helpful and rude. The room had a big bathroom but otherwise I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ane07
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff made our week stay there very pleasant. The rooms are small but that is expected in older hotels. It was very clean and a great location. You are a few blocks from some great resturants, the metro, the Termini Station. The lovely Santa Maria Maggiore is at the end of the street and makes a great landmark for finding your way back. We are already recommended this hotel to friends that are planning a trip next year. And the next time we visit we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money - Quaint, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nandanandana
Reviews.Content: Hotels are expensive in Rome, this one being on the more affordable end, but still a perfectly good place to stay. Our room was clean and comfortable. The terrace on the roof was a great place to relax after a long day and meet new people and it affords great views of the city including the Colosseum and St. Peter's Basilica. Breakfast was nothing special but perfectly fine. The hotel lobby and breakfast room were very charming and rustic and the staff was very helpful and friendly. If you take the train into Rome you can walk to the hotel from there, but if you need to take a taxi beware that they usually charge extra for suitcases. The trip to the hotel should really cost no more than 10 euros, but if you cannot find a taxi that won't charge extra for the suitcases you still should not pay more than 20 euros (which is still steep). When we arrived at the train station we went out the side exit to the street and the taxis were charging 30 euros for two people with two suitcases and were very rude when I expressed how expensive that was. So I went out the front exit and found another taxi for 20 euros. As I said, that is still a rip off, considering it only cost us 6 euros to go from the hotel to the train station when we were leaving, but if you don't have the patience to find a better deal, at least make sure to avoid the taxis charging 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TOSiteCer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights in late September and found that it met our needs quite well. The hotel is relatively close to many of the major sights in Rome, some within a half hour's walk. We visited Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon in one evening's walk. We even walked all the way to St. Peter's square in about 45 minutes. Of course, buses are available, and stops are nearby. We can't imagine walking like that in the heat of summer. The hotel is on a small side street, so we didn't hear any of the noise from the nearby major roadway. Sleeping wasn't a problem. The sound carries inside the hotel, though, between bathroom and bedroom. And sometimes the neighbours can be heard. Our room was clean and the bathroom was a good size for Italy. The shower is a bit small and awkward to get into, but that's normal. We were on the 4th floor. Our view was nothing to write about, but it was nice to open the windows wide. Breakfast was included with our room. Coffee from a machine, simple buns and/or pastries and donuts, cereal, cheese and meat slices. Enough to get you going. We found the staff friendly and helpful. We arrived a few hours before check-in and they stowed our luggage. When we returned a bit early, they had our room ready for us already. Rome has hills and uneven roads, and walking to this hotel towing luggage (from Termini station) may take only 15 minutes or so, but may be a bit annoying. If you have heavy luggage or lots of it, you might want to take a bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “great roof terrace, location and room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cherub2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights good location walking distance to a lot of the sites, roof terace provided a great place to sit and relax. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would have ben nice to have a kettle in the room. The only negative was the breakfast, the juice was from a machine and tasted powdery and also the hot drinks were from a machine and did not taste good (I was looking foreward to italian coffee and got something that tasted like a british vending machine). That said I would still recommend this hotel..just go round the corner to the cafe for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a few nights in Rome staying at this Hotel. Travel - from Fiumicino Airport take the Leonardo Express train (EUR14 one way). This is probably a lot quicker and cheaper than a taxi and takes 25 minutes. Hotel Location - about 10-15 minutes walk from the train station. If you are carrying luggage just beware that a lot of streets are cobbled, narrow and steep. A taxi is advisable if you are in a family group. Not sure about the bus services as I didn't use them however, the bus station is right next to the train station. Reception - large traditional style waiting area with an internet terminal. Keys are left with reception each time you leave the hotel. Staff speak english well. Porter - they have a porter who assists with baggage to your room. Not entirely sure why! Only 4 and 5 star hotels have them these days. Room - Clean and with good quality furniture. Remote controlled airconditioning. TV (only english channel being BBC World News). Quite a nice south facing balcony. No tea or coffee facilities. Internet - I think you have to pay to access the wireless network. However, I managed to tap into an unsecured network somewhere along the street! Breakfast - served from 7:30am. Choice of 2 cereals (cheap imitation Cornflakes or a crunchy museli), Doughnuts and pastries. Cheese, bread rolls, jams a few choices of cold meats. There is an automatic juice dispenser which I cant say was good at all. The coffee machine was fine. Everything was edible but it was far from being the best breakfast I've ever had at a hotel! Value - I booked as part of an Expedia package deal where the hotel was effectively free (the cost of the flight on its own exceeded the package deal). I would not wish to pay more than £60-65 had I paid full rate. Shops - there is a SPAR supermarket fairly close on Via Nazionle which is good for picking up water and snacks. Washing - noticed a laudrette on the main road behind the hotel! Could be handy for backpackers. Bars - Finnegans Irish bar is 5 minutes walk away, with Sky Sports and BBC/ITV. EUR6 for a Guiness! Colosseum - about 10 minutes walk away. Get there early (before 9:30am) and you will not have to queue up. Ignore the touts outside the monument. Entrance and guided tour is EUR14. Verdict - If you want something CLEAN, CENTRAL and in a SAFE location then this hotel could be for you. But don't expect any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: flyinghigh33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the historical district and within walking distance to the colosseum and other attractions. The metro is a few blocks away. It is on a quiet street. There is a roof top garden and it is a great place to relax in the evening and watch the sunset. The rooms are very clean but a fresh coat of paint would cover scuff marks and improve the looks. The staff was very helpful with directions and information. The continental breakfast was good. I especially liked the decor of the lobby and the breakfast area. If I visit Rome again I will be sure to stay at the Hotel Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice, helpful staff and wonderful rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2fly
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at the Hotel Colosseum in Rome for three nights mid September. The location is great, close to a Metro stop. The front desk staff was very cordial and helpful. The rooms are a bit austere, but very clean. The walls could use a coat of paint. The rooftop terrace is a great place to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening with a fabulous view. The breakfast was included, but very basic continental style. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and hospitable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ozzy771
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the August Bank holiday and found the hotel very clean and spacious with an excellent position to tour Rome, A beautiful back street which keeps you away from the hussle and bustle, very relaxing. All staff from breakfast staff to reception were fabulous with us, very helpful and courteous. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “bella bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: holidayjunkie777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short break in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Colosseum which we we found excellent. The staff at reception were very helpfull and friendly and not as prevously commented - grumpy old men! We were lucky enough to be allocated a fantastic room with its own large terrace giving fantastic views of Rome. Breakfast was good - cold meats, cheese, rolls and delicious pastries. Supermarket and eateries can be found by turning left out of the hotel and left again. I will recommend Pizza Flu Flu for takeaway or eat in pizza slices very good value. However our favourite was Ristorante Bar L'Esquilino where the food was amazing and the service brilliant. Thanks for making our anniversay so special!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Colosseum has it all, for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tullahlula
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome, back in June and were very happy with our choice of the Hotel Colosseum. We arrived at the Termini station from the airport and decided to walk to the hotel from there. Not a great idea, as we found out, the cobblestone pavement is too much stress on the suitcase wheels, so if there is, a next time in Rome, we would choose the same hotel but take a taxi there on arrival. On a regular basis it is a 10-15 min. walk to and from the Termini Station, so this makes for a perfect location to stay. The hotel is located on a quiet side street and is perfect for a great night's sleep. It is also close to shops, restaurants, supermarkets, tourist info. , buses and an English/Irish Pub. It is about a 20 min. walk to the Colosseum and Forum. The hotel itself, is very clean, if a little dated, furnished with a Spanish flair. The rooms are a fair size, air conditioned, nice bathroom and we were lucky enough to have a nice view but I believe this depends on the floor you are on. A buffet breakfast is served in the dinning room every morning, including cereal, pastries, breads, cheeses and meats and a variety of drinks. The wait staff are very pleasant and do their best to serve you. Reception staff were pleasant, if perhaps a little distant at first, but within the week turned out to be very helpful, answering any questions we had. The roof top garden has fabulous views. We spent some evenings up there eating food and wine we had purchased from the local supermarkets and watching the magnificent sunsets over Rome, this alone, is definitely worth staying at the Colosseum for. If we were to come to Rome again, I would have no hesitation in staying at The Hotel Colosseum and would recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “They changed our room booking when they realised we were a gay couple!”
Reviews.Author: knixuk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in April when we had to find somewhere quickly because of the ash cloud. We booked a double room. On arrival the men looked at us funny and muttered between themselves, clearly taken a back that two men wanted a double room. When we got to our room we discovered we were no longer in a double room but were now in a twin. We couldnt be bothered to argue about it, we felt uncomfortable enough. The room was ok, quite small but ok it was clean and had good shutters on the windows to block out the sunlight in the morning so we got a good night sleep... in the beds that we pushed together to make in to a double. The breakfast is not very good. The terrace at the top is nice and it is a good location but the rude staff put us off and we felt uncomfortable the whole time we were there. We had already booked three nights so stayed the three nights and then found somewhere else. Would not recommend this hotel because of the rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: munch2010
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that it is pretty much in the centre of Rome and minutes away from Termini railway station, which is very handy. It’s 3-star hotel, so do not expect something special. Staff was helpful, but food wasn’t great at all (unfortunately).

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly, clean with lovely rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: thruthelookingglass
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our week-long stay in this hotel. The gentlemen at the front desk were friendly and very helpful, recommending some very good neighborhood restaurants. The Cavour metro stop is less than a block away, putting us within easy access of everything we visited Rome to see. The quiet street is a respite from the wonderful chaos that is Rome and the rooftop terrace is such a nice place to sip some wine and decompress after a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Basic, no frills hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blp1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned yesterday from a trip to Italy, and for our 6 days in Rome we stayed at the Colosseum Hotel. We chose it because of a recommendation from a friend and the good reviews we read online. We loved the location because we were able to walk to all the city's highlights. We did take the Metro to the Vatican rather than walk, and the hotel is conveniently located near Termini train station and Metro stops. We took the train into Rome and the train to the airport, so being a short walk to Termini was great. Our room was very basic and simple, not fancy, but adequate for the price we booked through Travelocity. The room was always clean and the bathrooms appear to have been updated recently. The walls could have used a fresh coat of paint. Breakfast was simple, but we were just happy to have it included. The rooftop patio was great! We were also able to access the Internet for free on the hotel computer for the first few days of our stay, but at the end you needed a password, so I think typically you probably pay for the access. It is on a quiet street, small and alley-like. Most of the staff was very polite. One of the front desk workers asked if we'd like the hotel to arrange our transport to the airport through their chaffeur service, and when we declined, he was cold and rude to us for the rest of our stay. I was disappointed about that because up until that point I had no complaints whatsoever. If you are looking for a fancy hotel, this is not the place to stay, but if you need a simple, affordable hotel to use as a homebase for your exploration of Rome, the Colosseum Hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Cburton
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 20-27 and the experience was wonderful. I have read several people comment on the cold front desk help, and that could not be further from the truth. I think it is just the Italian way so to speak. Every time I asked for directions or needed assistance they were anxious to assist. You just have to ask. For the most part they will leave you alone, same way in the resturants. The rooms were spacious as they could be, bathrooms clean and refreshed every day. Showers had plenty of water pressure and hot water. The roof top terrance is as advertised, a real treat with fantastic views for the city. The breakfast was great, meats, cheese, yogurts, breads, etc and the staff was friendly and very helpful. One morning we slept in until 9:20 and breakfast closes @ 9:30. I raced down stairs and one of the ladies helped me put together a tray for my family, she dropped what she was doing to help a dope who overslept, they didn't have to do that. The same ladies who served breakfast also cleaned the rooms afterward so they needed to wrap up breakfast so they could go on. I was very impressed! We found a couple of great places to eat also, there is a pizza place called something like Pizza Flu Flu around the corner, left out of the hotel, left at the church, then left again on next street, place is on left. They had 3.5e kabob sandwiches (chicken and beef combo) that were great and the pizza was real good. Another place was called "La Forchetta d'oro" Which is around the corner the other direction. Great meals, locals love it and very reasonable prices. There is a Bike Rental shop called Top Bike Rental. www.topbikerental.com, just around the corner, we took a 6 hour guided tour of Appian Way with them and it was great, well worth it, would recommend them to anyone, they love their city and really show a unique perspective. There is a Tourist Information booth across the street for church that was very helpful we stopped in multiple times for advice and directions. They were very helpful and pleasant. This hotel is very well situated to see entire city and I would stay here or in this area again. It always felt safe and I believe the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location - Front desk staffed by cold employees”
Reviews.Author: siliwishes
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really liked hotel Colesseum. The front desk staff at all hours is not very friendly and pretty stand offish, but once I remembered reading that on this site, I could at least be like, "OK, it's nothing against me!" The bed was comfortable, the shower was a good size for a European hotel, and the breakfast was decent. You have to hike it up a sizeable hill to get there, which kind of stinks. The roof top patio is very nice. Also, they have a good computer in their lobby to use the Internet for a reasonable fee. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: DaveS_44
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a four-night stay at the Hotel Colosseum and enjoyed every minute of our time in this wonderful city. First the hotel itself: clean, comfortable and set in a nice quiet location on a side street. Others have commented that they found the reception staff a little 'stand-offish'. This was not our experience though: everyone on the desk was friendly and helpful. Special thanks must go to Angelo who helped us through a problem with delayed luggage. He took the time to call the airline on our behalf more than once - and advised us on the best place to buy a few items of clothing to see us through. Service was consistently first-class. Other reviewers have mentioned the wonderful rooftop terrace and it is a great feature of the hotel. The location is perfect. The Colosseum and Roman Forum are only about 10 minutes walk away. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and other attractions can all be walked to with no problem. In fact, the only way to see this city is to stroll through it; that way you get a feel for the place, people and culture - and you constantly stumble across interesting new sights. The hop-on hop-off bus is well worth the ticket price and takes you to a number of locations including the Vatican. We used the yellow Rome Cristiana bus that has a stop very close to the hotel. Just turn left from the front door and walk up towards the big church you can see. Then at the end of the road turn right. After a few yards you'll see the bus stop by the side of the road, just before the tourist information booth. If you want to avoid the long queues at the Vatican, you can buy a tour ticket from the ORP office. It's on the left of the road just before you reach the Vatican itself. The Colosseum was no problem; we strolled down for about 8:45am and walked straight in with no queue. The evening walk through the city from Edenwalks is excellent, and gives a terrific insight into Rome's history. There are lots of restaurants around the hotel. We only tried a couple but didn't run across the service charge problem others have mentioned. I would definitely recommend La Mela D'Oro - a charming little place with friendly staff and lovely food at reasonable prices. Take a left from the hotel door, walk to the end of the road so you are facing the church, turn left and follow the road round to the left so you are on Via S M Maggiore. The restaurant is a few yards down on the left. Other reviewers have said that Romans are arrogant. I have to say that we found the exact opposite. They are warm and friendly people who will always take the time to help you out. Perhaps it's down to way you approach them. A friendly smile and a word or two in Italian (however mispronounced!) goes a long way. To sum up: a great little hotel, lovely people and one of the best cities in the world. If you are keen to immerse yourself in the history and culture of the place, Rome will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend trip to Rome. The hotel was booked on a number of the reviews from Tripadvisor as well as the discounted rate for november. In all I have to say that it is great budjet hotel, with a great location for the weekend traveller. In fact we walked to most of the "must see's" except the vatican. I made contact with the hotel prior to our arrival to request a room with a balcony as it was my partners birthday during our stay. They did not dissapoint, and upon arrival we were given room 72 which is possibly the best room in the hotel with a balcony overlooking the south of rome, with the Santa Maria basillica to the left,and the Colosseum to the right (thank you Stefano, it was very kind). I have to balance this obvious aim to please mentality against those reviews highlighting stand offish staff, for I have to agree there are some. This generally relates to the reception staff, who do their job but do seem a little officious. Anyway do not let this put you off. I put it down to it's just the way they are. The breakfast is good quality, the hotel clean and tidy as are the rooms. The rooftop terrace is fantastic. The weather was still ok so we were able to enjoy a bottle of wine up there as the sun set. We got the leonardo express from Fumicino airport. They run every half our, non stop and would recommend. The hotel is a 10 minute walk down the Via Cavour but take a good map to find Via Sforza. There are a number of good eateries around the Via Palermo/Via del Boschetto quarter and they are reasonably priced. We went to the Piazza Novano one night. It cost 6 euros in a cab and was worth it. It is has a lovely atmosphere. There are numerous places to eat but be mindful that it can be pricey!! we should have looked around more as we were hit with a %15 service charge. The Vatican is an obvious must, be mindful that it has 2 entrences and if you get off the metro at Ottoviano you will be nearer St peters Sq and Basilica. The museums are nearer the Cipro stop. We got off too early and had a fair walk to the museum entrances. They are amazing though. You must go. In all agreat stay at a good/great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bodwellct
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and the location was great. The front desk staff, especially during the morning, was not overly friendly. However, we now know the locations of the subway stops and can walk to the historic sights without help. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel amidst chaos”
Reviews.Author: LondonKarenH
Reviews.Content: Hotel was hard to find initally so get a decent map. Once found it was easy to navigate. Rome is amazing and anywhere you stay is convenient really. Hotel about 8 min walk from Termini station which is just near enough to not warrant a cab with your suitcase (walk unless raining, much cheaper). Hotel and its side street is very quiet indeed and you get a great nights sleep despite Rome being hectic. The roof terrace on the 8th floor is adorable and we spent every evening up there watching sun go down, or having drinks with fellow tourists we had met. Only ever a handful of people up there but we had 4 scorching days so used it frequently. Breakfast adequate but quite simple. The concierge guys were not rude as some people stated, just low key and respectful. They also had your key waiting as you walked through the door so great service in those small ways. Cosy, intimate hotel with a large bathroom. Enjoyed my stay and would recommend for a mid price break. If you want something more glamorous it is not the place for you. The only minor complaint is that we had 3 single beds in our room so seemed a waste of space for us but no biggie. 2 tips, avoid the American Cafe on the square near Piazza Maggiore, we were charge 52 euros for an omlette, tea and toast for 2 people!!!!!! On last day we ordered from the specials board without checking menu prices and apparently 8 euros for 2 pieces of toast is acceptable. However go to the Chicken restaurant on Via Cavore (across road from 2 chinese restaurants). Amazing, amazing food and atmosphere, we went twice it was so good. Hotel is a bit of a trek from some places but Rome is big and you need to wear v v comfy shoes like trainers. Quite a lot of streets are uphill or dozens of steps just appear so you def use your leg muscles. Taxi to Vatican from hotel was 10 euros which is good. 20 min walk to Trevi, Spanish Steps, 15 min to Colosseum etc so good location for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop terrace was a wonderful place to rejuvenate.”
Reviews.Author: twoheart
Reviews.Content: It was great to have a place to rejuvenate after a busy day of sightseeing. It was a great place to hang out when we needed to take a break and wanted toenjoy the beautiful days. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side for American standards, but very nicely put together. The breakfast included croissants, prosciutto am, cheese, yogurt, granola, cappacuinno and juices. The location was very aood...a couple of blocks from a Metro stop and a couple more from the main terminal. It was an easy walk to the Colosseum and a walkable distance to most tourist sites (with fresh feet). We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: London1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days on the way out to Sardinia. The hotel was so close to the metro, and it made it really easy (after we'd figured out the system!) to get to and from the airport, and around the city itself. The street was really quiet and we heard no city noise, considering how close we were to all the major sights. We never had any bother walking around after dark in the area. The roof terrace was such a great bonus, and it was beautiful sitting up there after a hot day being tourists in the city. The rooms were just the right size, the bathrooms were small but spotlessly clean and the air-conditioning was great after the boiling Rome summer heat.
