Breakfast buffet was ample and there was enough of a variation so as not to get bored for a short stay. The staff on the front desk were friendly enough, all in all it was a great stay. There is a great restaurant in the square by Santa Magoire church nearby. (the table cloths were yellow - can't remember the name). As you go to the end of Via Sforza towards the church, there is an entrance to it on your right. The food was very reasonable (for Rome!) and it was generous and fresh. The staff were lovely there, and one waiter came running down the road after us because we'd left something on our table! Also, if you go in August, expect it to be very, very hot, but take a good water bottle as there are water fountains all over the city which are perfectly safe to drink from. Also, we went to the Pyramide area one evening and it was the only time we really felt unsafe in Rome, it had a real edge to it, it might've just been the time of year, but keep your wits about you if you venture there after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: SteelersfanAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and were very happy with it. The location and price were great. Step outside the hotel and to your left you can see the Santa Maria Maggiore and to your right after a short walk downhill is the metro Cavour. The AC was fantastic! After walking around all day in hot and humid weather it was like coming back to an oasis! We let the AC run all day so that upon our return it was heavenly cool. The breakfast was adequate: cheese, meat, rolls, croissasnts, jam, butter, yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice (same items everyday). Hotel was fairly quiet. Our room faced the street which is generally very quiet, low traffic, except for Saturday night when people were partying in the street. Room was very small. Beds were comfy. Bathroom was excellent: good water pressure, great shower, no problems with hot water. Internet for a fee worked great. Staff was helpful if you approached them. The price and location can't be beat. I would not feel comfortable walking alone after dark however. The steet is deserted at night. We felt fine with the two of us, just be aware of your surroundings after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!!”
Reviews.Author: amyhoop
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing, so near to ancient rome. really safe area although this is in one of the back roads of the main street. tube station literally minutes walk away and the main station approx 10 min walk. had a great room with beautiful views over rome. not great service at the front desk but for us it was all about the location and the spacious room was a bonus!! highly recommend and will definatly return. * students and under 25's eu residents get discount on many of the main attractions so take passports and student cards/ ISIC cards. * St Angelos Castle is well worth a visit although doesnt look to great from the outside well worth the trip because the best views on rome from the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with an amazing roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Kizzy81
Reviews.Content: The hotel surpassed all expectations. The room was very clean, fresh decor, a great shower and good air conditioning which was much appreciated after treking round in 37C heat!! The roof terrace is a delight. After walking about all day in the busy streets of Rome it's a real treat to relax with a glass of wine and appreciate the lovely views in peace and quiet. We were very happy as we got the room for a real bargain in comparison with other hotels. I would definitely come back to the Colosseum Hotel....... maybe not during the summer months as Rome was a little bit too hot for a Scottish lass!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: halcins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2009 for 2 nights and we enjoyed every moment. The room was elegant with a nice view of Rome, modern bathroom and you can be served drinks on the roof terrace. All staff speaks good English and is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rexy2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June, hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooftop is a brilliant place to relax after a busy day walking the streets of Rome, feel the owners are missing something by not having a bar area up on the roof as there is such a beautiful view from up there and its so relaxing. The location is great, within walking distance of many of the wonderful sites of Rome or close to the metro and open top bus stops. As the hotel is located off a main road then sleep isn't a problem, the rooms are fairly large and cleaned daily, the breakfast was ok but not really a great deal of choice however what was on offer was tasty enough! The safe was extra but at 2.50 euros for the 4 days was good value. All in all no complaints about this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelfiend_9
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The AC was great, very important for our hot days in Rome. The room was comfortable and the bed was great. The rooftop atrium was a real treat. After walking all day in Rome, it was so relaxing to go up to the rooftop with drinks in hand to reflect on the day's activities. The location is awesome too. The breakfast was really good - the pastries and rolls were top notch. The coffee wasn't the best, but then again it was nice not to pay 4 Euros a cup for a thimbleful of java. It was nice to have a working tv (not like our previous hotel) with CNN. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient at a good price”
Reviews.Author: cmdtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a flight/hotel package through Expedia, so the nightly rate worked out to be very affordable (probably about $80-90/night). The room was definitely large enough, and we had a nice view out over the rooftops and a church in the distance that had beautiful bells we got to hear a few times (but not at hours that awakened us!). As I think other people have mentioned, the bathroom size was fine but the shower stall was pretty tiny and could genuinely be a problem for larger people. The room and bathroom were spotless and the whole hotel was nicely kept. All of the men working the front desk that we met spoke enough English, and a few were totally fluent. Breakfast was simple but adequate for us...crusty rolls, buns, croissants (if you got there early enough), soft cheese, jams, yummy granola, yogurt, juices, and they made cappucinos for anyone by request. The hotel does not have a ton of amenities or luxury touches, but the point for us was to be out of the hotel and see Rome so it was fine! As far as location, we are young and active and don't mind a walk...we could get to the Colosseum in about ten minutes, fifteen max. The closest metro stop, Cavour, was about five minutes walk, and takes you to Termini or to the Colosseum in one stop. We took a taxi back twice at night from the general area of Trevi Fountain when we'd missed the Metro closing, and it cost about 8 euro. There were several pizza places within a couple minutes of the hotel that looked popular, although we didn't try them. The neighborhood felt very safe even late at night. The hotel is not on a main street so it was pretty quiet in our room. The hotel itself is a little difficult to find the first time, as other people have mentioned. If you walk up Via Cavour from the metro, there is a sign pointing to the right for Hotel Colosseum. Turn right as soon as you can after that sign into a wide alley and go up a big flight of stairs, then at the top turn right at the next intersection for the hotel. Overall, made a great base for our stay and would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Steph64
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay in Rome. Spent a week in the Colosseum Hotel and found the room to be adequate. Very reasonable rates for the location and lovely views from the rooms at the higher floors and the roof terrace. We stayed on the 7th floor and unfortunately the lift is an older model and seems to be somewhat selective in picking up residents ;-) Most of the time we had to use the stairs, which didn't bother us, but older people or disabled people might want to ask for a romm on a lower level. The room was a good size and very clean. Room and ensuite were cleaned every day. The breakfast was continental but not a great selection. We liked the location of the hotel, as it was very close to the metro and also in walking distance to the Colesseum and the Forum. The hotel is located off the main road, which means that you will get a good night's sleep. There are also some lovely little restaurants and a scooter rental shop on your doorstep. Staff members are friendly, but a few words of Italian would be helpful, as not all of them speak English. The front desk staff are nice, but somewhat peculiar - Monthy Pyton comes to mind. They are trying to be helpful when asked, but could be more forthcoming. All in all we had good stay - cheep and cheerful - and we would stay there again. If you are not too fussy you will have a nice stay at this hotel. One last piece of advice: Allways leave your key at reception and don't take it off the key ring or you will be told off.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent i will be back”
Reviews.Author: MRazak
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to brindisi on 17th January. Due to flight connections had to spend one night in Rome on my way and 2 on the return. Since I was aware of the short stay in Rome, I used this page to find an accessible hotel. As per the rating, and through venere.com I did my booking to Hotel Colosseum (17 jan) and Duca de Albi ( 26-27 Jan) Both are 50 meters away from Couvur metro station. Advantage of this hotel: - Excellent location - Near restaurants and shops - Big and clean rooms - No noise from the roads neither from the hotel rooms. Disadvantages: - No breakfast before 7:30 - You need to pay internet per hour - Staff (needs improvement) If you are planning a short stay in Roma, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevinandhelena
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, 5 mins to the metro, 10 minutes walk to the train station, 10 mins to the colosseum and about 45mins walk across the city to the Vatican. Clean hotel with good breakfast. Slightly annoying that additional services (room safe, internet) are charged extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Rome in August for four days and we found the hotel to be at an excellent location. The hotel is clean and the rooms are quite big for an European hotel. The location is great and it is easy access to Colosseum and various locations within the city centre. It is a great base for us. We got the Roma Pass which allow us to enter the Colosseum and Roman Forum without queuing! You can get the pass from Termini or the airport. We took the taxi from FCO which is quite costly but worth it because the hotel is quite difficult to find at first. Overall this is a great hotel to stay in Rome. Don't forget to visit the top floor of the hotel to get some great views.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ciy”
Reviews.Author: Kaapsenooi
Reviews.Content: Found the location good. The hotel was clean, our room was excellent, good bed and fresh linen daily, room smelt lovely and air conditioned. The reception was very good, particularly Toni who went out of his way to be helpful, friendly and welcoming. The only negative comment is that they can improve on their continental breakfasts, not in line with the rest of Europe. We would deffinitely stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: Aitch43
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome having stayed four night's at the hotel, as others have said its on a back street the room was small (twin room), it could have done with a lick of paint, no tea or coffee facilities in the room, the shower was a total shock the doors to the shower opened about one foot because the toilet and bidey were in the way the only way to get in was to push one door in and sqease your way in can provide photo. On the floor we were on light fittings with wires showing just taped up, not very safe!. Never saw the bar open you had to ask if you wanted to take something to your room. On a good point room was cleaned every day, with bedding and towels changed every day. I would not stay there again, I would not rate it as 3 star

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, lovely litle hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraKildare
Reviews.Content: Myself and My sister stayed in this hotel in june 2006 for 4 nights. We booked over the internet and were a bit unsure of it until we got there. It was lovely and clean. In a fantastic location within walking didtance from the Colosseum. The View from the rooftop garden was beautful a very peacefull place in a busy city. Loved this hotel plan to go back again in April 2008. Cant Wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but odd location”
Reviews.Author: ScottishLlama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pleasant, small, and clean (by the way, unless you are in an upper floor, your view will be a wall about three feet from your window), but in a very odd location to have the Colosseum as its namesake. As you walk down Via Cavour towards the Colosseum, you see that there are plenty of hotels closer to it, and many that are on the main road. This hotel is in a neighborhood, a couple of blocks off the beaten track. So it seems to me that if what you want is to stay near Ancient Rome, there are probably closer and/or better options. That being said, if you're visiting Rome for the first time, I would recommend staying a bit further north. The Colosseum and Ancient Rome are really the only attractions in the area, which is itself a bit plagued with graffiti. Everything else -- fountains, castles, the Vatican, etc. -- is either a considerable walk (almost as hour to the Vatican) or a 10 euro taxi ride. The area up by the river (say, between the Vatican and Trevi Fountain) is much nicer and, it seems to me, more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hctils
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel Aug 20th to Aug 24th and have no complaints. The hotel is very clean, average sized rooms and very quiet. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and towels changed. The air conditioning which is now included in the price worked very well and was needed. The safety deposit in our room was excellent value at just 2.50 Euros for our 4 nights stay. The breakfast room is quite large compared to other hotels in Rome. The breakfast is continental but everything was fresh and the cappichino was really good, the two waitress there were very pleasant. My favourite part of this hotel was the roof top terrace, we were a party of 8 family members travelling together and it was a great place to meet up before going out for our evening meal. There is a shop on Via Cavour that sells wine at 5 euros for 4 bottles so we could have a drink before going out and most nights when we got back, we were often up there til 1am. We also saw some of the guests have there evening meal there with food they had bought. Overall I would recommend this hotel but personally would prefer to stay closer to the Pantheon area of Rome. This hotel is great for the Colosseum and the Forum but did find it a bit of a trek to other sites and the heat didn't help. There is a metro stop quite close which would have made it a lot easier but we walked everywhere. There is also a bit of a hill to go up to reach the hotel from Via Cavour or steps slightly further up Via Cavour also get you to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: young7898
Reviews.Content: After taking a shuttle bus from the airport to Termini, I thought it would be a short easy walk to the hotel. It's actually not easy to find. Although Via Sforza looks easy on the maps, it's actually up a steep set of stairs at one end, and a small alley at the other. The hotel was reasonably priced, and well placed for ancient Rome. My single room on the 7th floor was very small, but had all the essentials - clean bed, toilet and shower, effective AC, and a balcony. The area is quite grubby, with drinkers sitting around, and an adult theater on one corner. I wouldn't recommend it for females. All in all, this was perfectly adequate for my 2 night stay, but I would probably look elsewhere next time, especially if I had company.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: angelsis
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel Colosseum at the end of June last week. The hotel is perfectly placed for access to the metro system and it is literally 5 or 6 mins walk from the Colosseum. You have to pass a tourist information booth on the way to the Colosseum, and i reccomend popping in to find out how to avoid the queues (at both the vatican and the colosseum). The passes reccomended are well worth it! The only problem with the hotel is that the rooms are a little small and in need of updating. However it was clean and tidy and the blinds and air conditioning worked great! (We met people that had paid significantly more per night who said they did not have air conditioning and were not impressed with their hotel room!) The breakfast was great (continental only). Staff helpfull, when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bluenosers
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of 4 people (2 couples) and we stayed at this hotel on October 4, 2006. After reading the reviews on this and other websites, we were a little apprehensive of our choice of this hotel. However, upon arriving, we were delighted with the hotel, our room, and its proximity to ancient Rome. The front desk staff spoke enough English to be helpful. Our room was small (which is to be expected anywhere in Europe) but it was clean and had everything we needed. The rooftop terrace was a great added feature and we enjoyed a late-night glass of wine overlooking a panoramic view of Rome. Considering that the noise and insanity of Rome traffic is only 1 or 2 blocks away, we found the hotel to be very quiet and well situated. The continental breakfast was very nice, all the food was very tasty, the coffee hot and the 2 female servers were very pleasant (even though they couldn't speak English). My advice to anyone travelling to Italy is to learn a few words of Italian (hello, goodbye, please, thank you) and to remember that a smile goes a long way. If you smile and try to speak a little of their language, they'll meet you halfway and your experience will be a lot more enjoyable. We would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet, comfortable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “an affordable, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jordbær
Reviews.Content: After having stayed a week at the hotel, we would highly recommend it to people who are looking for an affordable, good location stay in Rome. The hotel is charming, there are no unnecessary luxury, but the rooms are clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a great rooftop where you can view the whole city. The rooms are fairly small, but room 72 and 74 are two out of three rooms with amazing, private balconies where you can have wonderful picnics your own style.(bring a table cloth and you are all set for the most romantic dinner) They brought us wine as we arrived and they truly did the little extra to make our stay wonderful. The breakfast is simple, but great coffee with warm milk.

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was only one night!”
Reviews.Author: BurgieBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night since it was rated 3 stars and was close to the Colliseum. Our taxi driver was rather disgruntled trying to reach the front entrance due to the hotel's location (really a back street). Our tour bus the next day could not come to us and we had to walk several blocks to meet the bus which would never have fit on the street in front of the hotel. Reception staff seemed nice enough although upon checkin, the first sign of trouble - the elevator wasn't working. With 2 large bags and 3 small ones, we lugged them to the 2nd floor. Our room was tiny and with a view of walls!!! We had 3 single beds cramed into a small room. After arriving, we decided to rest a few hours from our overseas flight. After resting, we discovered the power was out. Their Italian explanation seemed to blame the city but upon observation, it appeared to be their breaker panels. Now with no AC, no TV, no power for charging electronic batteries, we decided to leave and sightsee. We hoped they would have the problem fixed upon our return. Upon our return, the 2nd floor halls were totally dark - not a good sign. When we commented, they came up and hit some breakers and we had hall lights. As usual they apologized. Now we were really apprehensive about room power. It was working. The next morning we rose early for our breakfast and bus tour. My wife had taken her shower the night before. When I turned on the shower, guess what? Absolutely no hot water, not even warm water. Walking down the stairs again, we ate their continental breakfast which was fairly good. We drug our packed bags down to their bag storage room (elevator still broken) and left for our tour. Upon our return, we checked out, mentioning to the receptionist about no power, cold shower water and tiny bathroom. They apologized and gave us a 20% discount on the bill. I guess this soothed us somewhat although after flown for 12 hours, the first thing you want is a warm shower. Hotel is overrated (3 stars) and we would never stay there again! One night was bad enough and not really the easiest place to find when walking. Rating system needs revised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieRedditchEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have just returned from the hotel colosseum after an enjoyable stay of 4 nights there. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but very clean and contain all that is needed. The breakfast is adequate for a continental breakfast and one particular waitress is very friendly and pleaseant. I am very glad we chose this hotel after reading past reviews on trip advisor, as it is well situated and good value for money. We would definatley go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research looking for a hotel that would suit us all, as there were six of us in our party. We all enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms were what I would expect for a 3 star hotel. They were very clean, good size, great comfortable beds, great shower with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was adequate, juice, cereal, yogurt and rolls. Weather permitting you can enjoy the view of Rome from the rooftop garden whilst sipping a nice glass of Italian wine which can be ordered from the bar (we brought our own bar with us !). About 10 minutes walk to the Colossuem and the Termini Station and 20 minutes to the Spanish steps, the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore Bascillia is right on your door step. We spent 4 days in Rome saw so much, but there is still so many other sites we would love to see. Threw plenty of coins in the Trevi Fountain so hope to return to the eternal city again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located,there are several nice restaurants to be found in the area,andthere is no traffic noise to be heard from the street.Good breakfast.From the rooftop the view is amazing,the staff is very friendly,I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of several main attractions (Forum Romanum, Colosseum) and there are several nice restaurants to be found in the area. The room and shower weren't big, but they were adequate and they were very clean. Also noteworthy is that there is no traffic noise to be heard, nor noise from other guests. Good breakfast and great rooftop view!

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel staff were friendly (except for 1 crusty old receptionist). Rooms are tiny but very clean. Showers are a tiny and a bit hard to move around in. My parents airconditioning conked out around midnight and we complained to the person at the desk. He said to open the windows and there was nothing he could do at that hour. He didn't offer to move them to another room nor give them a discount. That was very disappointing. I recommend a hotel near the Spanish steps which is much more centrally located. But Rome is such a beautiful city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night weekend break in Rome. The Hotel Colosseum is generally a really nice hotel, with very friendly staff. The hotel is located centrally, in an ideal place for visiting all of the tourist attractions. It is only 5/10 minutes walk from the Termini Train Station, and although it's centrally located, it is just off the main street, so you don't hear all the traffic noise. The only problem we did have was with some unexplicable noise in the early hours of the morning. The first morning it started at 7.00am, and came from the room directly above us. It was either very noisey quests, or cleaners, because the following morning it started at 5.30am! It literally sounded like furniture been moved and somebody walking around in heels! I think this was just bad luck on our part, but it even woke us up when we were wearing earplugs! We didn't complain about this, as the first morning we thought it was noisey guests and we would be leaving early the following morning anyhow, to get our flight back home...5.30am was definately too early though for a wake up call! We would have definately asked to have changed rooms if we had stayed longer. The continental breakfast was good, with a choice of two cereals, croisants or bread, fruit juice, coffee, tea. The views of Rome from the roof terrrace was also really good. Our room was fairly large, and clean, with a decent sized bathroom, with shower over the bath. All in all we really enjoyed our stay at the Colosseum Hotel, and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for central Rome”
Reviews.Author: eden2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights. Rooms lovely and clean, although showers tiny! Very quiet hotel only 10 minutes walk to centre of Rome, easy to get to from airport via bus and Metro - Metro stop just a few minutes walk. Breakfast adequate. Great roof terrace. No tea/coffee making facilities, only found out on last day that we could have orderd it via room service. Ask! Lots of eating places close by. happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my super 4 star choice in favour of this hotel after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. We were glad that we did. The hotel was exceptionally well built, did not hear a squeak from any other guests. The staff were at all times friendly, helpful, polite and unobtrusive. Rooftop views and privacy fantastic. Found plenty of quality bars and restaurants well within walking distance. There was a Taxi Rank at the end of the road which meant that every conceivable trip (Vatican, Spanish Steps, San Giavani in Laterano, were all less than €10 - these mark out the furthest extent of Rome (appx). Breakfast was fine, massive bowls of different flavoured yoghurts, croissants etc. The rooms were perfectly adequate, plenty of hanging space and draws -spotlessly clean. We will probably go again...

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay in Rome's hotel Colosseum.The Hotel is situated just a ten minute walk ( or a five euro taxi fare) from Rome's central train station ( termini) and is within walking distance of Rome's main tourist attractions, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc. The rooms are small, however they contain everything you'd expect. The hotel is spotlessly clean, is in a quiet location, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooftop terrace provides excellent views of Rome and is perfect for sunbathers. Would recommend.
